item.title: Sink Hole, 27th February
item.description:
Sink Hole: main road in front of 21-23 Sandhurst Road. Closed off via barriers in front of 23 + 17 Sandhurst - the barrier in front of 17 was demolished by reckless driver approx 22:00 - could be dangerous if sink hole deteriorates! Please attend with urgency! Signpost + Close off!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandhurst Road, Blendon, Greater London

item.title: Unsafe Parking on roundabout exit, 27th February
item.description:
A lorry was parked on the side of the motorway immediately after the first exit slip road at M25 Junction 2. Its position created a significant safety hazard for vehicles exiting the junction, as it reduced visibility and left insufficient space for drivers to safely merge, slow down, or react. This is a high-speed area, and a stationary HGV so close to the exit poses a serious risk of collision, particularly during busy periods. At times two lorries are parked, with one on the 26/02/26 partially pulled out into the Left lane causing my self to emergency stop to allow the lorry to park on the side. This has been ongoing for at least 2 months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Darenth Interchange, Brooklands, Dartford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Invasive bamboo entering playground, 27th February
item.description:
There is a large mass of bamboo which has been spreading out from one of the residential properties in Towncourt crescent into the willet rec playground . The problem with bamboo is that it is very invasive and if this is left unchecked it will spread into the play area and could even break through the tennis courts which will be dangerous and expensive to fix . This bamboo needs to be fully dug out and then any remaining roots should be treated with a herbicide to kill it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsway, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot holes on this road, 27th February
item.description:
Several pot holes along this stretch of Marlborough Road. Getting deeper due to heavy vehicles using this road. Really dangerous for cyclists especially early mornings and evenings.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 94, Marlborough Road, Archway, Greater London
